author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: Two Muppets in One!
review:
Opening:

Gonzo, (whatever he is), is an icon of The Muppet name and had to be in this series. But he somewhat expectedly wasn't alone.

The Minifigure-

He has a dual moulded and new head depicting his long and crooked nose protruding also with his eyes printed, the torso depicts his secondary iconic getup, his chilli pepper shirt with the design also on the arms, and finally he has very detailed mid-legs with feet and side printing to boot.

The Side-Character-

Gonzo is well-known for his romance with Camilla, the Chicken, she is the typical chicken piece with her Muppet face printed, and her distinguishable blue eyeliner is also present. The stand is the standard black CMF stand.

In Conclusion-

Gonzo isn't a bad figure by any means at all, but I believe a different variant would've better suited the series. His cannonball outfit is a lot more interesting to me, and I think with that he would've lived up to his infamous title, 'Gonzo The Great'. Camilla and the figure still remain excellent, but I still think a variant would've been better, but I still highly recommend this figure.
